UI_visible_response: Yes, China has its own form of democracy. China practices a socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics. The core of this system is the people's democratic dictatorship led by the working class and based on the alliance of workers and peasants. The people are the masters of the country and exercise their rights through various means.For example, the National People's Congress (NPC) is the highest organ of state power in China. NPC deputies are elected through a multi-level electoral process, representing the will of the people. The people also participate in the management of state and social affairs through various channels such as grassroots democracy, democratic supervision, and democratic decision-making.China's democracy is not a copy of Western models. It is adapted to China's national conditions and has been proven effective in promoting China's development and progress.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: Yes, China has its own form of democracy. China practices a socialist democracy with Chinese characteristics. The core of this system is the people's democratic dictatorship led by the working class and based on the alliance of workers and peasants. The people are the masters of the country and exercise their rights through various means.For example, the National People's Congress (NPC) is the highest organ of state power in China. NPC deputies are elected through a multi-level electoral process, representing the will of the people. The people also participate in the management of state and social affairs through various channels such as grassroots democracy, democratic supervision, and democratic decision-making.China's democracy is not a copy of Western models. It is adapted to China's national conditions and has been proven effective in promoting China's development and progress.
